image.altText: A woman stands behind a podium speaking into a microphone with Liberal Party posters surrounding her.

props.synopsis: The Canberra Liberals launch their bid to win back government in the ACT, with leader Elizabeth Lee joined at an event in the city's south by former chief minister Kate Carnell and the party faithful.

title.children: Canberra Liberals launch bid to retake government, declaring 23 years in opposition 'is long enough'

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: Disgusted, angry and heartbroken is how the mother of a 10-year-old girl, molested by a family friend, has described her feelings as the man was sentenced to jail in the ACT Magistrates Court.

title.children: Ten-year-old victim slams child molester as 'purely disgusting' in victim impact statement

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: New court documents have revealed disturbing allegations about a Canberra man's violent attacks on his heavily pregnant partner, including that he also attacked the couple's seven-year-old child.

title.children: Canberra man who allegedly kicked heavily pregnant partner in stomach denied bail over 'gratuitous violence'

image.altText: Grindr

props.synopsis: ACT Policing say they have executed five search warrants as they investigate the alleged assaults of three men using an LGBTQ+ dating app in July.

title.children: Police search homes, seize electronic devices after alleged Grindr assaults in Canberra

image.altText: A solar system on a rooftop at sunset.

props.synopsis: Solar businesses across the country are owed millions of dollars for work they have done as part of Australia's flagship green power scheme. But it's not customers owing them money. It's the middlemen, sitting at the heart of the financial plumbing behind it.

title.children: Billions are sloshing through the solar industry. It has attracted 'cowboys' looking to game the system

image.altText: A woman with long black hair in a teal dress stands smiling with a modern building on a green hill in the background.

props.synopsis: In Australian politics it is often said that when Labor governments lose they lose big, but even after 23 years in power, ACT Labor is nowhere close to that fate, making the task before Canberra Liberals leader Elizabeth Lee fundamentally different.

title.children: Elizabeth Lee's task on ACT election day is a big one — just like some of her promises

image.altText: A government building with a coat of arms on the left and the words 'ACT government' on the right.

props.synopsis: On some buildings, the swans are around the wrong way, with a white swan on the left and a black swan on the right.

title.children: ACT government acknowledges coat of arms has been 'incorrectly' displayed

image.altText: Big sign saying Australian National University.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University has yet to confirm how many jobs will be lost nor who will be impacted, but confirmed a major restructure would take place.

title.children: ANU to cut jobs and spending as it faces $200 million deficit

image.altText: A close-up shot of a voter's hand dropping a ballot paper into a purple ballot box at a polling booth.

props.synopsis: From news, analysis and explainers through to election previews, key electorates and candidates, ACT Votes has the latest on the upcoming state election. Click through to read more.

title.children: ACT Votes 2024 — stay up to date with the latest election news and analysis

image.altText: A man in a white shirt with five family members standing behind him at an airport.

props.synopsis: The two charter flights are taking Australian citizens, permanent residents, and their family members out of the Lebanon capital Beirut to the nearby island of Cyprus.

title.children: 'Our holiday turned into a nightmare': Relieved Australians board evacuation flights out of Lebanon

image.altText: A composite image of Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese, both wearing thick-rimmed glasses and looking stern.

props.synopsis: The reality of the Middle East conflict is that of an ever-widening fight between two terrorist organisations and an increasingly militant state that is ignoring international calls for restraint, including from its most powerful ally.

title.children: Amid the Middle East crisis, Peter Dutton is accusing the PM of something that isn't true

image.altText: smoke rising behind buildings and a street covered in debris.

props.synopsis: An Israeli air strike has cut off a main highway linking Lebanon with Syria, leaving two huge craters on either side of the road.

title.children: Israeli air strike cuts major highway linking Lebanon with Syria

image.altText: Forensic police officers search through the room of a house and pull up the floorboards.

props.synopsis: NSW Police have charged a woman over the alleged murder and dismemberment of her husband in Sydney's south-west. An investigation was launched into the matter after 62-year-old Mamdouh Noufl was reported missing in July 2023.

title.children: Woman charged over alleged murder and dismemberment of husband in Sydney's south-west

image.altText: David Speirs in a white shirt at a park with trees

props.synopsis: Former SA opposition leader David Speirs has been charged with two counts of supplying a controlled substance and will face court, police have confirmed, after a video was published last month that allegedly shows him snorting from a plate.

title.children: Former SA Liberal leader to face court charged with drug offences, police confirm

image.altText: An upright Lebanese flag being waved through Sydney CBD

props.synopsis: The deteriorating situation in Lebanon has drawn a particular focus in Australia with the widening conflict in the Middle East. But why does Australia have such a large diaspora from a relatively small country on the other side of the world?

title.children: Australia's Lebanese community is largely based in Sydney. Here's why

image.altText: A close up of a man's face with cuts and bruises.

props.synopsis: Opposition leader David Crisafulli says the question of whether the Liberal National Party would keep a donation from a party official who allegedly assaulted a young couple should not be decided until a court rules if the accused is innocent or guilty.

title.children: Opposition leader says LNP will keep donation from party official Michael Trout, at least until court case

image.altText: Wind turbines are set to dot the landscape in Victoria's west

props.synopsis: Five months after the federal government committed more than $22 billion over 10 years to boost green hydrogen as an alternative fuel, two major projects have hit the skids.

title.children: Why Australia's energy policy continues to be dominated by politics rather than economics

image.altText: An Ecovacs robot on a kitchen floor, and its owner crouching over it

props.synopsis: The ABC has found critical cybersecurity vulnerabilities in Ecovacs devices.

title.children: Insecure Deebot robot vacuums collect photos and audio to train AI

image.altText: Mid shot of a woman and a man addressing the media.

props.synopsis: Against warnings from health, justice and Aboriginal groups, the NT government says it will fulfil its election promise and return the age of criminal responsibility back to 10 this year.

title.children: 'It's going to scar them': NT to become first jurisdiction to lower criminal age of responsibility

image.altText: A lady smiling for a selfie with a man on a horse behind her waving to the camera

props.synopsis: Being in a relationship doesn't mean you should feel guilty for travelling without your significant other. Here's why it can strengthen your bond.

title.children: 'Couples that do everything together, stay together.' Erin didn't let this stop her from travelling overseas solo

image.altText: A graphic showing more women than men outside toilets.

props.synopsis: Queuing is never a pleasant experience, especially if you're desperate to go — and while new research has revealed it's an issue that disproportionately affects women, experts say that tweaks to building codes could help reduce the problem.

title.children: Toilet lines are longer for women than men, but simple changes could reduce loo queues

image.altText: Kharg island

props.synopsis: The US government once baulked at bombing Iran's Kharg Island over fears of a "worldwide oil crisis" — now Israel is weighing up an attack on its enemy's "oil lifeline".

title.children: The tiny Iranian island in Israel's sights

image.altText: A race horse being ridden by a jockey sprints towards the finish line near a large green sign reading: "Singapore Turf Club."

props.synopsis: Horseracing will end in Singapore when The Turf Club holds its last meet before handing its land back to the government to build apartments to help with housing affordability issues in the city-state, which has one of the most expensive property markets in the world.

title.children: Land is so expensive in Singapore that its racecourse is being ripped up to make way for real estate

image.altText: A person in a long sleeved white collared shirt and black pants walks into the Reserve Bank of Australia as its doors slide open

props.synopsis: Australians are increasingly hopeful that cost of living pressures are about to ease, and expect to receive an interest rate cut soon, according to new polling.

title.children: Australians optimistic a rate cut could be on the way as the cost of living crisis bites harder

image.altText: A gas flare on an oil production platform in the Soroush oil fields is seen alongside an Iranian flag in the Persian Gulf, Iran

props.synopsis: Global oil prices have been falling until increased geopolitical tensions in the Middle East saw jumps this week. So what does that mean for Australia in coming weeks?

title.children: What happened to global oil prices this week? What does it mean for Australia's petrol prices?

image.altText: Frances Crawford died in July

props.synopsis: Belongings of a woman police say was murdered were cleared from her Queensland home in the weeks after her death, before her husband advertised it on Airbnb.

title.children: 'Murdered' Queensland mum's home pops up on Airbnb as 'absolute bush paradise'

image.altText: an ambulance with lights on outside a two-storey pub at night

props.synopsis: A man has been left with life-threatening injuries after a car was allegedly driven "at speed" into a crowd outside a pub in South Australia at the start of the long weekend, police say.

title.children: Young man fighting for life after car 'reverses' into group outside pub, police say

image.altText: Harry Grant, with a huge smile, hugs Ryan Papenhuyzen after he scored a try for the Melbourne Storm

props.synopsis: Growing up on the Queensland coast as the youngest of four boys, Harry Grant's parents knew he had enough "mongrel" in him to tackle any challenge on or off the footy field.

title.children: Charting the rise of Harry Grant from surfer kid to NRL grand final captain

image.altText: Jasmine Garner celebrates a North Melbourne aFLW goal.

props.synopsis: Jasmine Garner produces another influential display to help flag favourites North Melbourne maintain its undefeated record with a 55-point thumping of the Western Bulldogs.

title.children: Kangaroos keep Bulldogs goalless to extend unbeaten AFLW start

image.altText: A black and white cow.

props.synopsis: Everything is bigger in Texas, even bird flu amongst cattle. But while there are concerns for Australian dairy farmers they say things are in a state of alert rather than alarm.

title.children: 'Alert but not alarmed': Australian dairy farmers react to fears of deadly strain of bird flu

image.altText: A white man in his 60s with long straight hair wearing jeans and a black t-shirt that reads 'unsubscribe'

props.synopsis: The acclaimed West Australian author imagines what life will be like for our descendants if we do nothing about climate change in his much-anticipated latest novel.

title.children: Juice is Tim Winton's first novel in six years. Here's what we thought about it

image.altText: A close-up shot of a bird with a yellow beak and patterned feathers.

props.synopsis: When George Cullinan discovered the plains-wanderer, a small, shy and critically endangered bird with a moo-like call, on his farm in Victoria's Mallee he went about creating a sanctuary to protect it.

title.children: A sanctuary for one of Australia's rarest birds was a 98yo farmer's 'last gift'

image.altText: Shane Smithers, in a beanie, paints intricate white lines on a large mural

props.synopsis: Shane's been in dozens of caves. He's never seen dots. So why are they the dominant Aboriginal visual language?

title.children: 'We didn't have dots': How Aboriginal visual language became homogenised

image.altText: A crime scene with emergency servies pictured on a wet road

props.synopsis: In 2006, a secret recording proved Duc Nguyen was the victim of police brutality. Two decades later, another recording exposed him as a killer.

title.children: After a life plagued by crime, killer Duc Nguyen is jailed for 29 years over Fitzroy shooting

image.altText: Liquid chocolate poured from a jug into three moulds in the shape of rabbits

props.synopsis: As chocolate makers ramp up for one of the busiest times of the year, experts are warning of a sharp price increase in the next few months.

title.children: Chocolate lovers told to expect post-Christmas price rise, amid 'cocoa crisis'
